meanings.definition: The position or duties of a guardian.
meanings.sent1: In some families, the guardianships of the children are shared between relatives.
meanings.sent2: The court appointed her to take on the guardianships of the orphaned siblings.
meanings.sent3: The teddy bear claimed the guardianships of all the toys in the playroom.
meanings.sent4: The wise owl took on the guardianships of the forest, ensuring all creatures were safe.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's main duty was to protect the city, taking on the guardianships of its citizens.

meanings.definition: The state of being under the protection of a guardian.
meanings.sent1: The children felt safe knowing they were under the guardianships of their caring aunt.
meanings.sent2: The elderly woman was under the guardianships of a kind nurse who looked after her.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten pretended to be under the guardianships of the dog, causing chaos.
meanings.sent4: The fragile butterfly sought the guardianships of the flowers to shield itself from the wind.
meanings.sent5: The lost puppy found comfort in the guardianships of the park ranger who rescued it.
